title: Island of the Lotus‑Eaters
description: Odysseus’ crew eats the lotus plant and forgets their homes.
details: Odysseus must drag them back to the ships to continue the journey.

title: Cyclops’ Cave
description: Odysseus blinds Polyphemus to escape captivity.
details: By telling the Cyclops his name is 'Nobody', Odysseus and his men slip away under the sheep.

title: Aeolus’ Bag of Winds
description: Aeolus gives Odysseus a bag containing all the winds.
details: Odysseus' crew opens it prematurely, blowing them off course.

title: Laestrygonian Giants
details: They destroy all ships except Odysseus’, devouring many men.

title: Circe’s Island
description: Circe turns Odysseus’ men into pigs.
details: Hermes gives Odysseus a herb to resist her magic; she then aids them.

title: The Underworld
description: Odysseus visits the Underworld and speaks with the prophet Tiresias.
details: He learns how to appease Poseidon and hears from fallen heroes.

title: The Sirens
description: Odysseus sails past the Sirens whose song lures sailors to their doom.
details: He plugs his crew’s ears with beeswax and has himself tied to the mast.

title: Scylla and Charybdis
description: Odysseus navigates between Scylla and Charybdis.
details: He loses six men to Scylla rather than risk the whirlpool.

title: Cattle of the Sun
description: Despite warnings, the crew slaughters Helios’ sacred cattle.
details: Zeus punishes them with a storm, leaving Odysseus alone.

title: Calypso’s Island
description: Calypso holds Odysseus captive on Ogygia for seven years.
details: She offers him immortality; Hermes orders her to release him.

title: Nausicaa’s Beach
description: Nausicaa discovers Odysseus washed ashore and brings him to the Phaeacians.
details: Her kindness leads to Odysseus receiving help to return home.

title: Phaeacian Court
description: Odysseus is welcomed at King Alcinous’ court in Phaeacia.
details: He remains anonymous while feasting and listening to songs of Troy.

title: Phaeacian Court
description: Odysseus competes in athletic games held by the Phaeacians.
details: After winning, he is moved to tears by a bard’s song of the Trojan War.

title: Disguise in Ithaca
description: Back in Ithaca, Odysseus disguises himself as a beggar.
details: Athena transforms him; he assesses the suitors and plans his revenge.

title: Final Vengeance and Reunion
description: Odysseus reveals himself, slaughters the suitors, and reunites with Penelope.
details: Peace is restored through Athena’s intervention.
